name: Fantastic Contraption
description: A surreal building game for VR. Create life-sized contraptions as tall as you can reach, then send them whirling, flinging, and trundling off to solve puzzles on the other side of a floating island. There are no right or wrong solutions, so bring your creativity.
minimum_requirements: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system OS: Windows 7+ Processor: Intel Core i5 4590 equivalent or greater Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 970/AMD Radeon R9 290 equivalent or greater DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 750 MB available space
recommended_requirements: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

reviews.review_text: 'Fantastic Contraption' is a great puzzle game that is seriously hampered in later levels by many physics, UI, design, and quality issues. These issues are relatively minor, but ultimately extremely frustrating because of how many other things this game does so well.  It feels GREAT to just start grabbing pieces and building a contraption. The actual physical movements are intuitive, for the most part. When everything works together, you can enact your idea in no time flat. When your idea works, you're on cloud nine -- the physical nature of the building helps lend a feeling of true ownership and accomplishment when your contraption solves the puzzle at hand.  However, there are several issues that can dissolve the bond between idea and action. These issues are relatively minor, but as the puzzles get more complex, the uncertainty and instability caused by these issues turn a fun and engaging puzzle game into an exercise of sheer frustration.  As of this current version, here are my collection of issues that I have noted...   Section 1: Lack of tutorialization or documentation
4.5/5 awesome physics Sim!
'Hmm, got this for free, might as well give it a go... WHAT JUST HAPPENED TO THE LAST HOUR?!'  Great game, I spent an embarrsingly long time just doing the puzzle on the floor.

I know building things sounds like a chore but you should probably use your brain for something other than murder for once. Alright - you can build things that seem alive and shatter them if you really want to. Also there's a ball that's disintegrated by lightning at the end of every level, you'll probably enjoy that.
Excellent. Great sense of immersion, very satisfying use of room space and it feels great to build a machine to solve the puzzle. One I'll keep coming back to.
Making things in VR. Fun and creative!
Got it with the Vive bundle. Not fun, and highly repetitive. Probably won't play again, there are much better (and cheaper) stuffs around for the Vive.
Found the options for creating very inpresice which made it very tedious to do anything. If it was reworked into something more like Besieged maybe i'd reccomend it.
got this for free. never play it. modbox is waaaaaaaaay better.
A modern classic. Kids will talk about this game the way past generations talk about Pipe Dream or Breakout. It's an almost perfect blend of puzzle solving & creativity.
I built a car to get my balls on the wall. Suck on that, Trump
Love it so far! Super cute, mindless happy VR that lets you build stuff. And you're a sheep. Bonus points for adorable sheeplyness.
I was not expecting to enjoy this game as much as I do. I've only had my Vive for two days but I've already played this game more than any other.

Well friends, let me start by saying I got this free with my Vive. Regardless, it's still a really great game. The challenges are varied and fun for the most part. It's incredibly intuitive to maneuver the pieces in any position.  One of the best ideas in the game is the inventory system. Need a stick? Reach over your shoulder. Looking for glue? Reach in your ear.  Using the helmet as the main menu is absolutely brilliant.  The most complaints I've heard about this game is the price. Hopefully the devs move in that direction, but overall this game really impressed me. I've played well over 30 Vive and oculus games and I still got a kick out of this one.
Fantastic game. If it didn't come with the Vive for free, I would still suggest picking it up if you like puzzle games.

So far I've only had time to play a little bit in this game but what I have played has been very entertaining! The ability to create random designs to accomplish the goals allows for some interesting differences in how different family members tackle problems! As much fun to watch what others do as to do it yourself. I just wish there was more variety to the objects you can use early on.
amazing game! Keep the good work!

an absolute showcase for room-scale VR with the Vive. Endlessly fun, I'll be coming back again and again to this one. It's like having an endless pile of digital legos or Erektor set, and some truly interesting challenges to frame it all up.  Also this has some of the most delightful UI choices I've seen yet on the Vive. The space helmet is amazing.
Great fun! Good challenge, more deep then most current VR games.

The game I want to love.. This was free with the Vive, and as far as current offerings go is probably one of the more feature complete experiences. That said however, I didn't really enjoy it. The physics work correctly, and the puzzles aren't all easy, but there was just something missing for me. Perhaps lack of parts? You really only have a wheel and two types of sticks to build with, so simplicity is it's essence. I tried it a few times because free, but unfortunately it is now at the bottom of my list of games to play again.
Very nice game! puzzles are fun, features are rich (Love the helmet) and I would recommend this to anyones collection. Enjoy banging your head against the wall on some of these :P fun fun fun...
Wierd and goofy puzzle type game that requires a creative mind. It runs well, and has a bit more 'high end' studio feel, a little more 'polish' if you will...
Interesting and different. Not a bad game at all. Easy controls and a different concept make all the difference here. Would give it an 8/10.
